title.narrative: Labour standards in global supply chains – a programme of action for Asia and the garment sector

description.narrative: This project was initiated as part of a Joint Declaration of Intent for a renewed partnership between the German Ministry for Development Cooperation (BMZ) and the ILO, signed in May 2014. The target countries for the project are Cambodia, Indonesia, and Pakistan. The project’s activities contribute to the Decent Work Country Programmes of the target countries. The project includes activities at the factory, national, regional, and global levels. The development object of this project is to improve the lives of workers and increase decent work opportunities in the global garmetn sector supply chain. The immediate objectives of Phase 2 of the project are: 1. Mechanisms for participatory and evidence-based minimum wage-fixing and collective bargaining will have been strengthened in the target countries. 2. Systems for assuring labour standards compliance at the factory level will have improved in the target countries. 3. The institutional capacity of tripartite partners to respond to labour standards challenges in the global garment sector supply chain will have improved.
